intro: Galopina aspera, commonly known as the rough galopina, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Galopina aspera is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
